div.l: Prometheus Unbound Act IV
Shelley MS e. 1,2,3
<ACT 4> {Act 4 1} Scene a part of forest near the cave of Prometheus--Panthea & Ione are sleeping--they awaken gradually during the first song.
{SD} Voice of unseen Spirits
The pale Stars are gone,--
For the Sun thier swift Shepherd
To their folds them compelling
In the depths of the Dawn
Hastes, in meteor-eclipsing array, & they flee
Beyond his blue dwelling,
As fawns flee the leopard . . .
But where are ye? {SB}
{SD} a train of dark forms & shadows passes by confusedly, singing--Panthea wakens
Here oh here!
We bear the bier
Of the father of many a cancelled year
Spectres we
Of dead hours be
We bear Time to his tomb in eternity {SB}
Strew oh strew
Hair, not yew!
Wet the dusty pall with tears, not dew!
Be the faded flowers
Of Deaths bare bowers
Spread on the corpse of the King of Hours{!} {SB}
Haste, oh haste!
As shades are chased
Trembling, by Day, from Heaven's blue waste{.}
We melt away
Like dissolving spray
From the children of a diviner day{,}
With the lullaby
Of winds that die
On the bosom of their own harmony {SB} {SD} they vanish
{SD} Ione
What dark forns were they? {SB}
{SD} Panthea
The past Hours weak & grey
With the spoil, which their toil
Raked together,
From the conquest but One could foil {SB}
{SD} Ione
Have they past? {SB} {HL}
{SD} Panthea
They have past
They outspeeded the blast,
While 'tis said, they are fled-- {SB}
{SD} Ione
Whither, oh whither? {SB}
{SD} Panthea
To the dark, to the past, to the dead. {SB}
{SD} Voice of unseen Spirits
Bright clouds float in Heaven,
Dew-stars gleam on Earth,
Waves assemble on Ocean,
They are gathered & driven
By the Storm of delight, by the panic of glee{.}
They shake with emotion--
They dance in their mirth{--}
But where are ye? {SB}
The pine-boughs are singing
Old songs with new gladness,
The billows & fountains
Fresh music are flinging
Like the notes of a spirit from land & from Sea
The storms mock the mountains
With the thunder of gladness.
But where are ye? {SB}
{SD} Ione
What charioteers are these {SB} {HL}
{SD} Panthea
Where are their chariots? {SB}
{SD} Semichorus of Hours. 1.
The voice of the Spirits of air & earth
Have drawn back the figured curtain of sleep
Which covered our being & darkened our birth
In the deep-- {SB} {HL}
{SD} a Voice
In the deep? {SB} {HL}
{SD} Semichorus 2.
Oh below the deep {SB}
{SD} Semichorus 1.
An hundred ages we had been kept
Cradled in visions of hate & care
And each one who waked as his brother slept
Found the truth-- {SB} {HL}
{SD} Semichorus 2.
Worse than his visions were {SB}
{SD} Semichorus 1.
We have heard the lute of Hope in sleep
We have known the voice of love in dream
We have felt the wand of Power, and leap-- {SB}
{SD} Semichorus 2
As the billows leap in the morning beam {SB}
{SD} Chorus
Weave the dance on the floor of the breeze,
Pierce with song Heaven's silent light,
Enchant the Day that too swiftly flees
To check its flight, ere the cave of Night; {SB}
Once the hungry Hours were hounds
Which chased the Day, like a bleeding deer
And it limped and stumbled with many wounds
Through the nightly dells of the desart year {SB}
But now--oh weave the mystic measure
Of music & dance and shapes of light,
Let the Hours & all Spirits of might & pleasure
Like the clouds & the sunbeams unite {SB} {HL}
{SD} a Voice
Unite{!} {SB}
{SD} Panthea
See where the Spirits of the human mind
Wrapt in sweet sounds, like radiant veils, approach {SB}
{SD} Chorus of Spirits
We join the throng
Of the dance & the song
By the whirlwind of gladness borne along;
As the flying-fish leap
From the Indian deep,
And mix with the sea birds half asleep. {SB}
{SD} Chorus of Hours
Whence come ye so wild & so fleet
For sandals of lightning are on your feet
And your wings are soft & swift as thought,
And your eyes are as Love which is veiled not{?} {SB}
{SD} Chorus of spirits
We come from the mind
Of human kind
Which was late so dusk & obscene & blind{;}
Now tis an Ocean,
Of clear emotion
A Heaven of serene & mighty motion. {SB}
From that deep Abyss
Of wonder & bliss
Whose caverns are chrystal palaces,
From those skiey towers
Where Thoughts crowned Powers
Sit watching your dance, ye happy Hours {SB}
From the dim recesses
Of woven caresses
Where lovers catch ye by your loose {sliding} tresses{,}--
From the azure isles
Where sweet Wisdom smiles
Delaying your ships with her syren wiles {SB}
From the temples high
Of man's ear & eye
Roofed over Sculpture & Poesy
From the murmurings
Of the unsealed springs
Where Science bedews {her} Dædal wings {SB}
Years after years
Through blood & tears
And a thick hell of hatreds & hopes & fears,
We waded & flew
And the islets were few
Where the bud-blighted flowers of happiness grew {SB}
Our feet now, every palm,
Are sandalled with calm,
And the dew of our wings is a rain of balm;
And beyond our eyes
The human love lies
Which makes all it gazes on, Paradise. {SB}
{SD} Chorus of Spirits & Hours
Then weave the web of the mystic measure;
From the depths of the sky & the ends of the Earth
Come, swift Spirits of might & of pleasure,
Fill the dance & the music of mirth,
As the waves of a thousand streams rush by
To an Ocean of splendour & harmony! {SB}
{SD} Chorus of Spirits
Our spoil is won
Our task is done
We are free to dive or soar or run {. . .}
Beyond or around
Or within the bound
Which clips the world with darkness round {SB}
We'll pass the Eyes
Of the starry skies
Into the hoar Deep to colonize
Death Chaos & Night,
From the sound of our flight
Shall flee, like mist from a Tempests might {SB}
And earth air & light
And the Spirit of Might
Which drives round the Stars in their fiery flight;
And love, thought, & breath
And the powers that quell death,
Wherever we soar shall assemble beneath! {SB}
And our singing shall build
In the Void's loose field,
A world for the spirit of Wisdom to weild{;}
We will take our plan
From the new world of man
And our work shall be called the Promethean {SB}
{SD} Chorus of Hours
Break the dance, & scatter the song
Let some depart & some remain{,} {SB}
{SD} Semichorus 1.
We, beyond Heaven, are driven along-- {SB}
{SD} Semichorus 2.
Us{,} the inchantments of Earth retain-- {SB}
{SD} Semichorus 1.
Ceaseless & rapid & fierce & free
With the Spirits which build a new earth & sea
And a Heaven where yet Heaven cd. never be-- {SB}
{SD} Semichorus 2.
Solemn & slow & serene & bright
Leading the day & outspeeding the night
With the Powers of a world of perfect light-- {SB}
{SD} Semichorus 1.
We whirl, singing loud, round the gathering sphere
Till the trees & the beasts, & the clouds appear
From its chaos made calm by love, not fear{--} {SB}
{SD} Semichorus
We encircle the Oceans & Mountains of Earth
And the happy forms of its death & birth
Change {to} the music of our sweet mirth {SB}
{SD} Chorus of Hours & Spirits
Break the dance & scatter the song--
Let some depart & some remain
Wherever we fly we lead along
In leashes, like starbeams, soft yet strong
The clouds that are heavy with Loves sweet rain {SB} they depart
{SD} {Pan}
Ha, they are gone! {SB} {HL}
{SD} Ione
Yet feel you no delight
From the past sweetness? {SB} {HL}
{SD} Panthea
As the bare green hill
When some soft cloud vanishes into rain
Laughs with a thousand drops of sunny water
To the unpavilioned sky{!} {SB} {HL}
{SD} Ione
Even whilst we speak
New notes arise . . . what is that awful sound {SB}
{SD} Panthea
Tis the deep music of the rolling world
Kindling within the strings of the waved air
Æolian modulations {SB} {HL}
{SD} Ione
Listen too
How every pause is filled with under{-} notes
Clear, silver, icy, keen, awakening tones
Which pierce the sense & live within the soul
As the sharp stars pierce Winters chrystal air
And gaze upon themselves within the sea. {SB}
{SD} Panthea
But see, where through two openings in the forest
Which hanging branches overcanopy,
And where two runnels of a rivulet
Between the close moss violet-inwoven
Have made their path of melody, like sisters
Who part with sighs that they may meet in smiles
Turning their dear disunion to an isle
Of lovely grief, a wood of sweet sad thoughts
Two visions of strange radiance float upon
The Ocean-like inchantment of strong sound
Which flows intenser keener deeper yet
Under the ground & through the windless air {SB}
{SD} Ione
I see a chariot like that thinnest boat
In which the Mother of the Months is borne
By ebbing light into her western cave
When she upsprings from interlunar dreams,
Oer which is curved an orblike canopy
Of gentle darkness, & the hills & woods
Distinctly seen through that dusk aery veil
Regard like shapes in an enchanters glass;
Its wheels are solid clouds, azure & gold,
Such as the genii of the thunderstorm
Pile on the floor of the illumined sea
When the Sun rushes under it, they roll
And move & grow as with an inward wind.
Within it sits a winged Infant, white
Its countenance like the whiteness of bright snow,
Its plumes are as feathers of sunny frost,
Its limbs gleam white, thro the wind-flowing folds
Of its white robe, woof of ætherial pearl--
Its hair is white,--the brightness of white light
Scattered in strings, yet its two eyes are Heavens
Of liquid darkness, which the Deity
Within, seems pouring, as a storm is poured
From jagged clouds, out of their arrowy lashes
Tempering the cold & radiant air around
With fire which is not brightness, in its hand
It sways a quivering moonbeam, from whose point
A guiding power directs the chariots prow
Over its wheeled clouds, which as they roll
Over the grass & flowers & waves, wake sounds
Sweet as a singing rain of silver dew. {SB}
{SD} Panthea
And from the other opening in the wood
Rushes with loud & whirlwind harmony
A sphere, which is as many thousand spheres,
Solid as chrystal, yet through all its mass
Flow, as through empty space, music & light
Ten thousand orbs involving & involved
Purple & azure, <add>white & green &</add> golden
Sphere within sphere, & every space between
Peopled with unimaginable shapes
Such as ghosts dream dwell in the lampless deep
Yet each inter transpicuous, & they whirl
Over each other with a thousand motions
Upon a thousand sightless axles spinning
And with the force of self destroying swiftness
Intensely slowly solemnly roll on--
Kindling with many
Intelligible words & music wild
With mighty whirl the multitudinous Orb
Grinds the bright brook into an azure mist
Of elemental subtlety, like light,
And the wild odour of the forest flowers
The music of the living grass & air
The emerald light of leaf-entangled beams
Round its intense, yet self-conflicting speed,
Seem kneaded into one aerial mass
Which drowns the sense . . within the Orb itself,
Pillowed upon its alabaster arms,
Like a child overwearied with sweet toil,
On its <add>own</add> folded wings & wavy hair
The Spirit of the Earth is laid asleep
And you can see its little lips are moving
Amid the changing light of thir own smiles
Like one who talks of what he loves in dream{.}-- {SB}
{SD} Ione
'Tis only mocking the Orb's harmony . . . {SB}
{SD} Panthea
And from a star upon its forehead, shoot,
Like swords of azure fire, or golden spears
With tyrant-quelling myrtle overtwined,
Embleming Heaven & earth united now,
Vast beams like spokes of some invisible wheel
Which whirl as the orb whirls, swifter than thought,
Filling the abyss with sunlike lightenings
And perpendicular now, & now transverse
Pierce the dark soil, & as they pierce & pass
Make bare the secrets of the Earths deep he{ar}t.
Infinite mines of adamant & gold
Valueless stones & unimagined gems
And caverns on chrystalline columns poised
With vegetable silver overspread
Wells of unfathomed fire, & watersprings
Whence the great Sea, even as a child, is fed
Whose vapours clothe Earth's monarch mountain-tops
With kingly, ermine snow; the beams flash on
And make appear the melancholy ruins
Of cancelled cycles{;} anchors, beaks of ships
Planks turned to marble, quivers helms & spears{,}
And gorgon-headed targes, & the wheels
Of scythed chariots, & the emblazonry
Of trophies standards & armorial beasts
Round which Death laughed, sepulchered emblems
Of dead Destruction, ruin within ruin!
The wrecks beside of many a city vast
Whose population which the Earth grew over
Was mortal but not human, see, they lie
Thier monstrous works & uncouth skeletons,
Thier statues, homes, & fanes; prodigious shapes
Huddled in grey annihilation, split,
Jammed in the hard black deep{;} & over these
The anatomies of unknown winged things,
And fishes which were isles of living scale,
And serpents, bony chains, twisted around
The iron crags, or within heaps of dust
To which the tortuous strength of thier last pangs
Had crushed the iron crags;--& over these
The jagged alligator & the might
Of earth-convulsing behemoth, which once
Were monarch beasts, & on the slimy shores
And weed-overgrown continents of Earth
Increased & multiplied like summer worms
On an abandoned corpse, till the blue globe
Wrapt Deluge round it like a cloak, & they
Yelled, gaspt & were abolished; {or} some God
Whose throne was in a Comet, past, & cried--
Be not!--& like my words they were no more {SB}
{SD} The Earth
The joy, the triumph, the delight, the madness
The boundless, overflowing bursting gladness
The vapourous exultation, not to be confined!
Ha! ha! the Animation of delight
Which wraps me, like an atmosphere of light
And bears me as a cloud is borne by its own wind! {SB}
{SD} The Moon
Brother mine, calm wanderer
Happy globe of land & air
Some Spirit is darted like a beam from thee
Which penetrates my frozen frame
And passes with the warmth of flame--
With love & odour & deep melody
Through me, through me!-- {SB}
{SD} The Earth
Ha! ha,! the cavens of my hollow mountains
My cloven fire-crags, sound-exulting fountains
Laugh with a vast & inextinguishable laughter
The Oceans & the Desarts & the Abysses
Of the deep air's unmeasured wildernesses
Answer from <add>all</add> their clouds & billows, echoing after {SB}
They cry aloud as I do--Sceptered Curse
Who all our green & azure Universe
Threatenedst to muffle round with black destruction, sending
A solid cloud to rain hot thunderstones,
And splinter & knead down my childrens bones,
All I bring forth, to one void mass battering & blending {SB}
Until each craglike tower & storied column
Palace, & {O}belisk & Temple solemn
My imperial mountains crowned with cloud & snow & fire,
My sea-like forests, every blade & blossom
Which finds a grave or cradle on my bosom
Were stamped by thy strong hate into a lifeless mire {SB}
How art thou sunk, withdrawn, coverd--drunk up
By thirsty nothing, as the brackish cup
Drained by a Desart-troop--a little drop for all!
And from beneath, around, within, above,
Filling thy void annihilation, Love
Bursts in like light on caves cloven by the thunderball {SB}
{SD} The Moon
The Snow upon my lifeless mountains
Is loosened into living fountains
My solid Oceans flow & sing & shine
A spirit from my heart bursts forth
It clothes with unexpected birth
My cold bare bosom--oh, it must be thine
On mine, on mine! {SB}
Gazing on thee I feel I know
Green stalks burst forth, & bright flowers grow
And living shapes upon my bosom move
Music is in the sea & air
Winged clouds soar here & there
Dark with the rain new buds are dreaming of
'Tis Love, all Love! {SB}
{SD} The Earth
It interpenetrates my granite mass
Through tangled roots & trodden clay doth pass
Into the utmost leaves & delicat{es}t flowers{--}
Upon the winds, among the clouds 'tis spread
It wakes a life in the forgotten dead
They breathe a spirit up from their obscurest bowers {SB}
And like a storm, bursting its cloudy prison
With thunder & with whirlwind, has arisen
Out of the lampless caves of unimagined being
With earthquake shook & swiftness making shiver
Thought's stagnant chaos, unremoved forever,
Till Hate & Fear & Pain, light-vanquished shadows, fleeing {SB}
Leave Man, who was a manysided mirror
Which could distort to many a shape of error
This true fair world of things--a Sea reflecting Love;
Which over all his kind, as the Suns Heaven
Gliding oer Ocean smooth, serene & even,
Darting from starry depths radiance & life, doth move{.} {SB}
Leave Man, even as a leprous child is left
Who follows a sick beast to some warm cleft
Of rocks, through which the might of healing springs is poured
Then when it wanders home with rosy smile
Unconscious, & its mother fears awhile
It is a Spirit--then, weeps on her child restored. {SB}
Man, oh not men; a chain of linked thought
Of love & might to be divided not
Compelling the elements with adamantine stress--
As the Sun rules, even with a tyrants gaze
The unquiet Republic of the maze
Of Planets, struggling fierce towards Heavens free wilderness. {SB}
Man, one harmonious Soul of many a soul
Whose nature is it's own divine controul
Where all things flow to all, as rivers to the sea;
Familiar acts are beautiful <del><hi rend="underline">thro</hi></del> <del>by</del> love
Labour & Pain & Grief in life's green grove
Sport like tame beasts--none knew how gentle they could be {SB}
His Will, with all mean passions, bad delight{s}
And selfish cares, its trembling satellites,
A spirit ill to guide, but mighty to obey{;}
Is as a tempest-winged ship, whose helm
Love rules, through waves which dare not overwhelm
Forcing Life's wildest shores to own its sovereign{s} sway {SB}
All things confess his strength--Through the cold mass
Of marble & of colour his dreams pass
Bright threads, whence mothers weave the robes their children wear;
Language is a perpetual Orphic song
Ruling <del>Which rules</del> with dædal harmony, a throng
Of thoughts & forms, which else senseless & shapeless were {SB}
The Lightning is his slave; Heavens utmost deep
Gives up her stars, & like a flock of sheep
They pass before his eye, are numbered, & roll on!
The Tempest is his steed,--he strides the air!
And the abyss shouts from her depth laid bare
Heaven, hast thou secrets? Man unveils me, I have none {SB}
{SD} The Moon
The shadow of white Death has past
From my path in Heaven at last,
A clinging shroud of solid frost & sleep--
And through my newly-woven bowers
Wander happy paramours
Less mighty, but as mild as those who keep
Thy vales more deep. {SB}
{SD} The <hi rend="underline">Ear</hi>th
As the dissolving warmth of Dawn may fold
A half-unfrozen dewglobe, green & gold
And chrystalline, till it becomes a winged mist
And wanders up the vault of the blue Day
Outlives the noon, & on the Sun's last ray
Hangs oer the Sea; a fleece of fire & amethyst--{.} {SB}
{SD} The Moon
Thou art folded, thou art lying
In the light which is undying
Of thine own joy, & Heavens smile divine
All suns & constellations shower
On thee, a light a life a power
Which doth array thy sphere--thou pourest thine
On mine, on mine! {SB}
{SD} The <hi rend="underline">Earth</hi>
I spin beneath my pyramid of night
Which points into the Heavens, dreaming delight
Murmuring victorious joy in my enchanted sleep;
As a youth lulled in love-dreams, faintly sighing,
Under the shadow of his beauty lying
Which round his rest a watch of light & warmth doth keep {SB}
{SD} The <hi rend="underline">Moon</hi>
As in the soft & sweet eclipse
When soul meets soul on lovers lips
High hearts are calm & brightest eyes are dull
So when thy shadow falls on me
Then am I mute & still,--by thee
Covered; of thy love, Orb most beautiful,
Full, oh too full!-- {SB}
Thou art speeding round the Sun
Brightest World of many a one
Green & azure sphere, which shinest
With a light which is divinest
Among all the lamps of Heaven
To whom life & light is given;
I, thy chrystal paramour
Borne beside thee by a power
Like the polar Paradise
Magnet-like of lovers' eyes;
I, a most enamoured maiden
Whose weak brain is overladen
With the pleasure of her love--
Maniac-like around thee move,
Gazing, an insatiate bride
On thy form from every side
Like a Mænad, round the cup
Which Agave lifted up
In the wierd Cadmæan forest--
Brother, wheresoer thou soarest
I must hurry, whirl & follow
Thro' the Heavens wide & hollow,
Sheltered by the warm embrace
Of thy soul, from hungry space
Drinking, from thy sense & sight
Beauty, majesty{,} & might
As a lover or a cameleon
Grows like what it gazes on-- {SB}
{SD} The Earth
O Gentle moon, the voice of thy delight
Falls on me like thy clear & tender light
Soothing the seaman, borne the summer night
Thro' isles forever calm;
Oh Gentle Moon, thy chrystal accents pierce
The caverns of my Pride's deep Universe
Charming the Tyger Joy, whose tramplings fierce
Made wounds, which need thy balm {SB}
{SD} Panthea
I rise as from a bath of sparkling water,
A bath of azure light, among dark rocks,
Out of the stream of sound-- {SB} {HL}
{SD} Ione
Ah me, sweet sister
The stream of sound has ebbed away from us
And you pretend to rise out of its wave
Because your words fall like the clear soft dew
Shaken from a bathing wood nymphs limbs & hair {SB}
{SD} Panthea
Peace! Peace!--a mighty Power, which is as Darkness
Is rising out of Earth, & from the sky
Is showered like Night, & from within the air
Bursts, like eclipse which had been gathered up
Into the pores of <add>sun-</add>light--<del>&</del> the bright Visions
Wherein the singing spirits rode & shone
Gleam like pale meteors thro' a watery mist {SB}
{SD} Ione
There is a sense of words upon mine ear-- {SB}
{SD} Panthea
An universal sound like words . . . o list {SB}
{SD} Demogorgon
Thou Earth, calm Empire of a happy Soul,
Sphere of divinest shapes & harmonies
Beautiful orb! gathering as thou dost roll
The Love which paves thy path along the skies {SB}
{SD} The Earth
I hear,--I am as a drop of dew that dies! {SB}
{SD} Demogorgon
Thou Moon which gazest on the nightly earth
With wonder, as it gazes upon thee
Whilst each to men & beasts & the swift birth
Of birds, is beauty, love, calm, harmony {SB}
{SD}
I hear--I am a leaf shaken by thee! {SB}
{SD} Demogorgon
Ye Kings of suns & stars, Dæmons & Gods,
Ætherial Dominations, who possess
Elysian, windless, fortunate abodes
Beyond Heavens constellated wilderness {SB}
{SD} A Voice from above
Our great Republic hears . . . We are blest, & bless {SB}
{SD} Demogorgon
Ye happy Dead, whom beams of brightest verse
Are clouds to hide, not colours to pourtray
Whether your nature is that Universe
Which once Ye saw & suffered-- {SB} {HL}
{SD} A Voice from beneath
or as they
Whom we have left, we change & pass away{.}-- {SB}
{SD} Demogorgon
Ye elemental Genii, who have homes
From mans high mind even to the central stone
Of sullen lead, from Heavens star-fretted domes
To the dull weed some sea-worm battens on-- {SB}
{SD} A confused Voice
We hear--thy words waken Oblivion. {SB}
{SD} Demogorgon
Spirits whose homes are flesh--ye beasts & birds
Ye worms & fish--ye living leaves & buds--
Lightning & Wind--& ye untameable herds,
Meteors & mists, which <del>throng</del> feed Air's solitudes {SB}
{SD} a Voice
Thy voice to us is wind among still woods {SB}
{SD} Demogorgon
Man who wert once a despot & a slave,--
A dupe or a deciever,--a Decay
A Traveller from the cradle to the grave
Through the dim night of this immortal Day {SB}
{SD} All
Speak--thy strong words may never pass away {SB}
{SD} Demogorgon
This is the Day which down the void Abysm
At the Earthborn's spell yawns for Heavens Despotism
And conquest is dragged captive thro' the Deep;
Love from its awful {home} of patient power
In the wise heart, from the last giddy hour
Of dread endurance; from the slippery, steep,
And narrow verge of craglike Agony springs
And folds over the world its healing wings {SB}
Gentleness, Virtue, Wisdom & {E}ndurance,--
These are the seals of that most firm assurance
Which bars the pit over Destructions strength;
And if, with infirm hand, Eternity,
Mother of many acts & hours, should free
The serpent that would clasp her with his length,--
These are the spells by which to reassume
An empire o'er that disentangled Doom {SB}
To suffer woes which Hope thinks infinite
To forgive wrongs darker than Death or Night{;}
To defy Power, which seems Omnipotent;
To love, & bear; to hope<del>{,}</del> till Hope creates
From its own wreck the thing it contemplates
Neither to change nor falter nor repent
This, like thy glory, Titan! is to be
Good, great & joyous, beautiful & free
This is alone Life, Joy, Empire & Victory
